docs.lead_paragraph: Alarmed by soaring prices for cancer drugs, the leading American oncology society has devised a “value framework” to evaluate treatments by effectiveness, side effects and cost.

headline.main: Cancer Doctors Offer Way to Compare Medicines, Including by Cost
headline.print_headline: Evaluating Cancer Drugs on Cost, Too

docs.abstract: American Society of Clinical Oncology releases so-called value framework to help doctors and patients assess different cancer treatments according to rubric that includes cost as well as efficacy and possibility of side effects; release is part of shift among doctors to address rapid increases in prices of cancer drugs, and value framework takes into account out-of-pocket costs paid by patients and costs to health system.
docs.snippet: Alarmed by soaring prices for cancer drugs, the leading American oncology society has devised a “value framework” to evaluate treatments by effectiveness, side effects and cost.

docs.lead_paragraph: A reduction in the number of people having trouble paying medical bills appears to be an effect of the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Medical Insurance Is Good for Financial Health, Too
headline.print_headline: Medical Insurance Is Good for Financial Health

docs.abstract: The Upshot; survey conducted by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds that fewer Americans are having problems paying medical bills since Affordable Care Act went into effect in 2014, inadvertently improving public health.
docs.snippet: A reduction in the number of people having trouble paying medical bills appears to be an effect of the Affordable Care Act.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Austin Frakt is a health economist with several governmental and academic affiliations. He blogs at The Incidental Economist, and you can follow him on Twitter at @afrakt.

docs.lead_paragraph: The heir of the Samsung business empire bowed deep in apology Tuesday as criticism mounted over a Samsung hospital's role in spreading Middle East respiratory syndrome in South Korea.

headline.main: Samsung Heir Apologizes for MERS Spread at Samsung Hospital
headline.print_headline: Samsung Heir Apologizes for MERS Spread at Samsung Hospital

docs.snippet: The heir of the Samsung business empire bowed deep in apology Tuesday as criticism mounted over a Samsung hospital's role in spreading Middle East respiratory syndrome in South Korea.

docs.lead_paragraph: The average consumer should catch a price break if major health insurers like Anthem and Cigna combine and cut their expenses.

headline.main: Insurer Combos Offer No Price Break Guarantees for Consumers
headline.print_headline: Insurer Combos Offer No Price Break Guarantees for Consumers

docs.snippet: The average consumer should catch a price break if major health insurers like Anthem and Cigna combine and cut their expenses.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. health insurer Anthem Inc on Monday dismissed concerns that buying smaller competitor Cigna Corp would be considered anti-competitive, even as antitrust experts said the combination would earn regulatory scrutiny.

headline.main: Anthem Confident, but Experts See Antitrust Hurdles to Cigna Deal
headline.print_headline: Anthem Confident, but Experts See Antitrust Hurdles to Cigna Deal

docs.snippet: U.S. health insurer Anthem Inc on Monday dismissed concerns that buying smaller competitor Cigna Corp would be considered anti-competitive, even as antitrust experts said the combination would earn regulatory scrutiny.

docs.lead_paragraph: The right of same-sex couples to marry and the ability of low- and middle-income Americans to receive subsidies to help them afford insurance under the health care overhaul are the two biggest cases among the seven still to be decided by the Supreme Court.

headline.main: Gay Marriage, Health Care Among Last 7 Supreme Court Cases
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage, Health Care Among Last 7 Supreme Court Cases

docs.lead_paragraph: South African hospitals group Mediclinic International is buying almost a third of Britain's Spire Healthcare, entering a market it said was ripe for growth as private players account for a small fraction of the healthcare sector.

headline.main: South Africa's Mediclinic to Buy Into Britain's Spire in $700 Million Deal
headline.print_headline: South Africa's Mediclinic to Buy Into Britain's Spire in $700 Million Deal

docs.snippet: South African hospitals group Mediclinic International is buying almost a third of Britain's Spire Healthcare, entering a market it said was ripe for growth as private players account for a small fraction of the healthcare sector.

docs.lead_paragraph: The pushback against soaring cancer drug prices is gaining steam. A leading doctors group on Monday proposed a formula to help patients decide if a medicine is worth it — what it will cost them and how much good it is likely to do.

headline.main: Doctors Propose Tool to Help Gauge the Value of Cancer Drugs
headline.print_headline: Doctors Propose Tool to Help Gauge the Value of Cancer Drugs

docs.snippet: The pushback against soaring cancer drug prices is gaining steam. A leading doctors group on Monday proposed a formula to help patients decide if a medicine is worth it — what it will cost them and how much good it is likely to do.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday did not issue rulings in its two most closely watched cases - gay marriage and a challenge to President Barack Obama's healthcare law - and the justices will next release decisions on Thursday.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Next Issue Rulings on Thursday, Friday
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court to Next Issue Rulings on Thursday, Friday

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday did not issue rulings in its two most closely watched cases - gay marriage and a challenge to President Barack Obama's healthcare law - and the justices will next release decisions on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anthem sees its more than $47 billion bid to buy rival Cigna as a way to muscle up on technology that helps consumers and to strengthen its rapidly growing Medicare Advantage business.

headline.main: Anthem Reaffirms Commitment to Its $47-Billion Bid for Cigna
headline.print_headline: Anthem Reaffirms Commitment to Its $47-Billion Bid for Cigna

docs.snippet: Anthem sees its more than $47 billion bid to buy rival Cigna as a way to muscle up on technology that helps consumers and to strengthen its rapidly growing Medicare Advantage business.
